level.heading: Application to existing relationships.
level.text: On the effective date of this chapter [April 27, 2001]:

An act done before the effective date in any proceeding and any accrued right is not impaired by this chapter. If a right is acquired, extinguished, or barred upon the expiration of a prescribed period of time that has commenced to run by the provisions of any statute before the effective date, the provisions remain in force with respect to that right; and

Any rule of construction or presumption provided in this chapter applies to instruments executed and multiple-party accounts opened before the effective date unless there is a clear indication of a contrary intent.

level.text: For D.C. Law 13-292, see notes following § 19-501.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 12 of the Uniform Simultaneous Death Act (1993 Act).
